sub_title: Young Graduate Trainee in Systems Engineering at European Space Agency - ESA
summary:
I am a motivated young man who’s dream is to become an Aerospace Engineer on the long run. 

I had lived and worked in many different places thus I firmly believe that I’ve developed valuable interpersonal and intercultural skills that help me deal with people from various backgrounds.

Moreover, I am quite easy to work with since I'm always willing to learn new things and go down the extra mile in order to maintain quality work and professional relationships.

awards.title: The Kingston Award - Silver Level
awards.description:
The Kingston Award is a university-wide scheme which celebrates students engagement in university life, alongside or outside the framework of their degree course.  The Award recognises students for taking part in a range of different activities. Such as:  maintaining a part time work whilst studying, participating in external, national or international challenges or for volunteering activities.

https://mykingston.kingston.ac.uk/myuni/thekingstonaward/Pages/default.aspx

projects.title: BSc. Group Dissertation Project 'Astrea' - UK Students for the Exploration and Development of Space (UKSEDS) National Rocketry Challenge 2019
projects.description:
Our team is representing Kingston University for the yearly UKSEDS National Rocketry Challenge.
The teams are being judged by their ability to write design reviews and reports  regarding the actual stages of the projects (Preliminary Design Review, Critical Design Review, Flight Readiness Review) and by reaching the highest possible apogee.

projects.title: Institution of Mechanical Engineer's (IMechE) Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) Challenge 2018
projects.description:
In my second year at Kingston, we set up even more ambitious goals to our group with the Unmanned Aircraft Systems Challenge (UAS). To my direct initiation and discussion with the Head of School of Aerospace Engineering, our team got funded £2000 for the challenge. Our team is representing Kingston University for the first time at the annual UAS challenge. 

Within the competition teams have to design, manufacture, test and code a fully autonomous drone system, which has to be able to carry out series of mission scenarios. These scenarios include; autonomous flight, character recognition, payload delivery and reconnaissance. 

Although, our hexa-drone design was not finished by the challenge deadline I have managed to gain valuable technical competencies through the project;	
- I had the chance to apply my theoretical systems engineering knowledge to practice, 	
- Gained valuable interpersonal, leadership and management skills,
- Through the documentation of various design phases (Preliminary Design Review, Critical Design Review, Flight Readiness Review) I have increased my engineering report writing and presentation skills.

Mahmood Mohamed Hassani - Team Representation and Social Media
Lewis Musk - Manufacturing and Assembly
Kelsea Karim Lydz - Lead Programmer
Sharoz Ibrahim - 2nd Lead Programmer
Toby Studhleer - Logistics
Vladimir Vailonkin - Avionics and Electronics
Andres Tiivas - 2nd Lead Designer
Gaspar Dombovari - Project Manager, Lead Designer

projects.title: Electrical Heat Treatment of Hazardous Materials for the LISCO
projects.description:
The aim of the project was to eliminate the hazardous substances from the previously removed insulation material, by reaching high temperature to start the de-crystallization process in its fibre composition. (~1200°C)

In the planning phase of the project, I was actively contributing to the design review, manufacture and testing of the Electric Heat Treatment Machine along with receiving specialised laboratory training at Wessling Laboratories in Germany.

During my role as a Site Manager in the LISCO, I was personally responsible for the continuous operation of the Heat Treatment Plant.

First time in my life, I had the chance to oversee an engineering project from scratch designing trough manufacturing, testing and installation. Through this position I have gained significant people management and transferrable technical skills which composed the base of my later academic and professional life.

contributors.headline: Young Graduate Trainee in Systems Engineering at European Space Agency - ESA
project manager at ER-petro ltd.

projects.title: Asbestos Abatement Services on Power and Desalination Plant (PDP) of the Libyan Iron and Steel Company (LISCO)
projects.description:
The aim of the project was to replace Asbestos Contaminated pipe insulation within the LISCO's Thermal Power Plant and Desalination Plant (PDP). The hazardous  material was replaced with another fibre composited material, with similar thermodynamic properties.

Considering the fact that I had no experience before in industrial refurbishment and engineering projects, or had no previous education regarding engineering in college/university level, I proved to be a valuable member of the company's leadership and overseen a few more projects for the Libyan Iron and Steel Company.

Initially, I was personally responsible for the identification and measurement of the contractual pipeline system. Through the 9-month long project, I had to maintain and update work progression in databases and involved in the day-to-day communication with shift leaders for pipe identification. I was responsible for the insulation material ordering from overseas, based on my measurements. Later on, I created CAD drawings from the contractual pipeline system for the LISCO, because due to the local fights, the original and as-built-as drawings were destroyed. As the project matured forward, I began to contribute to the laboratory and sampling procedures as well.

I firmly believe overseeing such a high volume industrial engineering project in my early career, helped me to develop an insight view of engineering project operations and management throughout I feel I have acquired the required motivation, interest, passion to chase further experiences in the field of Engineering and Science.

profile_positions.title: Assistant Site Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: I was part of the volunteering team for the Department of Physics and Astronomy during Mars week at the National Space Centre in Leicester. During the event my main role was to engage with the audiance ranging from Primary School children to adult science enthusiasts, with an interactive 'clue finding scenario' describing the importance of the ExoMars mission and introducing the Raman spectroscopy imaging. My contribution to the project was to extend and enhance the interactive learning activities by Augmented Reality (AR) elements.
